sections.title: ABCC11

sentence_evaluations.sentence: **ATP-binding cassette transporter sub-family C member 11**, also **MRP8** (*Multidrug Resistance-Related Protein 8*), is a [membrane transporter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Membrane_transport_protein) that exports certain molecules from inside a cell.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence focuses on the protein's function.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: It is a [protein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protein) that in humans is encoded by [gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene) *ABCC11*.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence provides factual information.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The gene is responsible for determination of human [cerumen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earwax) type (wet or dry ear wax) and presence of underarm [osmidrosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osmidrosis) (odor associated with [sweat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perspiration) caused by [apocrine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocrine_gland) secretion), and is associated with [colostrum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colostrum) secretion.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence focuses on gene functions.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: First sentence of lead defines article scope.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The first sentence clearly defines ABCC11 as a membrane transporter.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Provides a comprehensive definition of the protein and its gene.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Lead sentence mentions ABCC11 which should link to Wikidata.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No visible linkage to a Wikidata item is present in the content provided.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No evidence of Wikidata linkage in the lead section.

sections.meta_notes: The section meets the scope definition but lacks linkage to Wikidata.

sections.title: Function

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the superfamily of [ATP-binding cassette](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ATP-binding_cassette_transporter) (ABC) transporters.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence provides functional information.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: ABC proteins transport various molecules across extra- and intra-cellular membranes.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes protein function.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: ABC genes are divided into seven distinct subfamilies (ABC1, MDR/TAP, MRP, ALD, OABP, GCN20, White).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence provides classification information.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The ABCC11 transporter is a member of the MRP subfamily which is involved in multi-drug resistance.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains subfamily involvement.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The product of this gene participates in physiological processes involving bile acids, conjugated steroids, and cyclic nucleotides.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence details physiological roles.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: In addition, a [single nucleotide polymorphism](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single_nucleotide_polymorphism) (SNP) in this gene is responsible for determination of human [earwax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earwax) type and presence of underarm odour.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains genetic influence.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: This gene and family member [ABCC12](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABCC12) are determined to be derived by duplication and are both localized to chromosome 16q12.1.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses gene duplication and localization.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Multiple alternatively spliced transcript variants have been described for this gene.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence mentions transcript variants.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Function section should describe protein function.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section comprehensively describes the function and roles of the ABCC11 protein.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Detailed description of protein function and involvement in physiological processes.

sections.meta_notes: The Function section thoroughly describes the protein's function.

sections.title: Molecular genetics

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The *ABCC11* [gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene) is present in the [human genome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_genome) as two [alleles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allele), differing in one [nucleotide](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nucleotide) also known as a [single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-nucleotide_polymorphism).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains genetic variations.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: A SNP in the *ABCC11* gene on [chromosome 16](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chromosome_16_(human)) at [base](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nucleobase) position 538 of either a [guanine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guanine) or [adenine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adenine) determines two distinct groups of [phenotypes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Phenotype).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence details genetic influence on phenotypes.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: These respectively code for [glycine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glycine) and [arginine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arginine) in the gene's [protein](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Protein) product.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains amino acid coding.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: [Dominant inheritance](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dominant_inheritance) of the GG or GA [genotype](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genotype) is observed while the AA genotype is recessive.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes inheritance patterns.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The phenotypes expressed by the genotypes include [cerumen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earwax) type (wet or dry ear wax), [osmidrosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Osmidrosis) (odor associated with [sweat](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perspiration) caused by excessive [apocrine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apocrine_gland) secretion), and possibly [breast cancer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Breast_cancer) risk, although there is ongoing debate on whether there is a real correlation of the wet ear wax phenotype to breast cancer susceptibility.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses phenotype expressions and associated risks.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The GG or GA genotype produces the wet ear wax phenotype (sticky and brown colored) and acrid sweat odor and is the dominant allele.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains genotype-phenotype correlation.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Note this phenotype requires only the presence of one guanine.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence highlights genetic requirements.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The [homozygous](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homozygous) recessive AA genotype produces the dry ear wax phenotype (dry and flaky) and mildly odored sweat.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes recessive genotype effects.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The alleles containing a guanine produce a protein that is [glycosylated](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glycosylation) but alleles containing an adenine are not glycosylated.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains protein modification.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The resulting protein is only partially degraded by [proteasomes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proteasome).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes protein degradation.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: This effect is localized to [ceruminous gland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cerumen) membranes.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence specifies localization effects.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Because the adenine containing allele protein product is only partially degraded, the remaining functional protein is located on the cell surface membrane which *ABCC11* gene's role in sweat odor is likely in part due to the quantitative dosage of ABCC11 protein.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains protein localization and function.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: From an [evolutionary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolution) perspective, the implications of cerumen type on [fitness](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fitness_(biology)) are unknown.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses evolutionary implications.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: However, odorless sweat in ancient Northern [Eurasian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eurasia) populations has been postulated to have an [adaptive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptation) advantage for cold weather.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses adaptive advantages.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: In some nonhuman [mammals](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mammal), [mating](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mating) signals via release of an odor enhanced by increased apocrine secretion may be a factor in [sexual selection](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sexual_selection).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses mating signals in mammals.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Physical [human](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human) traits that are controlled by a single gene are [uncommon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Human_genetics#Human_traits_with_simple_inheritance_patterns).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses genetic trait control.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Most human characteristics are controlled by multiple genes ([polygenes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantitative_trait_loci)); *ABCC11* is a peculiar example of a gene with unambiguous phenotypes that is controlled by a SNP.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence highlights ABCC11 as a unique gene example.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: Additionally, it is considered a [pleiotropic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pleiotropy) gene.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes gene functionality.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Function section should describe protein function.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The section comprehensively describes the function and roles of the ABCC11 protein.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: Detailed description of protein function and involvement in physiological processes.

sections.meta_notes: The Molecular genetics section meets content standards but lacks a separate Clinical significance section.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The history of the migration of humans can be traced back using the *ABCC11* gene alleles.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses human migration.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The variation between ear wax in [ethnicities](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnic_group) around the world are specifically due to the *ABCC11* gene alleles.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains genetic variation across ethnicities.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: It is believed that the derived allele originated in an ancient [East Asian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Asia) population.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses allele origins.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The gene may have spread as a result of it being a beneficial [adaption](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adaptation) or through an evolutionary neutral [mutation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mutation) mechanism that went through [genetic drift](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genetic_drift) events, or through sexual selection.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses gene spread mechanisms.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: An analysis of [ancient DNA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_DNA) of [Eastern Hunter Gatherers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eastern_Hunter-Gatherers), [Scandinavian Hunter Gatherers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scandinavian_Hunter-Gatherers), [Western Hunter Gatherers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Hunter-Gatherers) and [Early European Farmers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Early_European_Farmers) found that the derived allele of ABCC11 associated with dry earwax and reduced body odor was absent in all European hunter gatherers, except for a [Western Hunter Gatherer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Western_Hunter-Gatherers) from [Mesolithic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mesolithic) central Europe.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses genetic findings from ancient DNA.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The derived allele was absent in the paleolithic hunter gatherer [Kostenki 14](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kostyonki%E2%80%93Borshchyovo#Human_remains), who is deeply related to [Ancient North Eurasians](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_North_Eurasians).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence details allele absence in ancient samples.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The frequency of alleles for dry ear wax is most concentrated in [East Asia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/East_Asia); most notably [China](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China), [Japan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan), [Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korea), and [Mongolia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongolia).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses allele frequency distribution.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The allele frequency is highest among the northern [Han Chinese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_Chinese) and [Koreans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Koreans); followed by [Mongols](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongolia), southern Han Chinese, and [Yamato Japanese](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yamato_people), respectively.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence continues allele frequency discussion.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The frequency is low among the [Ryukyuan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryukyuans) and [Ainu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ainu_people).

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence mentions allele frequency in specific groups.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The derived allele is not rare in [South Asia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Asia), with 54% of [Dravidian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dravidian_people) people from [Tamil Nadu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tamil_Nadu) carrying an AA genotype.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses allele frequency in South Asia.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: A downward gradient of dry ear wax allele phenotypes can be drawn from northern China to southern Asia and an east–west gradient can also be drawn from eastern Siberia to western Europe.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence describes allele distribution gradients.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The [allele frequencies](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Allele_frequency) within ethnicities continued to be maintained because the *ABCC11* gene is inherited as a [haplotype](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haplotype), a group of genes or alleles that tend to be inherited as a single unit.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence explains haplotype inheritance.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: The amount of [volatile organic compounds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Volatile_organic_compound) (VOCs) in ear wax was found to be related to variation in ABCC11 [genotype](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Genotype), which in turn is dependent on ethnic origin.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses VOCs related to genotype.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: In particular, the rs17822931 genotype, which is especially prevalent in East Asians, is correlated with lower VOC levels.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence details genotype-VOC correlation.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

sentence_evaluations.sentence: However, VOC levels were not found to vary significantly qualitatively nor quantitatively for most organic compounds by racial group after [Bonferroni corrections](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonferroni_correction), suggesting that it does not result in ethnic differences.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Applicable to article prose to prevent study hyping.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: No listing of authors' qualifications; the sentence discusses statistical findings on VOC levels.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No mention of study authors' qualifications.

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: Clinical significance section is required to list related diseases or conditions.
requirement_evaluations.reasoning: The article does not have a separate Clinical significance section to list diseases associated with gene mutations or protein imbalances.
requirement_evaluations.evidence: No Clinical significance section present in the article.

article_evaluation.meta_notes: The article meets most imperative standards but is missing a Clinical significance section and linkage to a Wikidata item.
